intro: Cheirinia leptostyla, commonly known as the slender-stemmed cheirinia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cheirinia leptostyla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
